official-title.#text:
To amend the Military Construction Authorization Act, 1974 to authorize the Secretary of Defense to
			 decontaminate certain portions of the former bombardment area on the
			 island of Culebra, Puerto Rico.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Use of former bombardment area on island of Culebra, Puerto Rico

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and its formerly used defense sites.

text.#text:
It is the sense of Congress that the statutory prohibition restricting environmental cleanup of the
			 former bombardment area on the island of Culebra, Puerto Rico, is a unique
			 anomaly for the

quote.#text:
The first sentence of this subsection shall not apply to the portions of the former bombardment
			 area that were identified as having regular public access in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 2815 of the Ike Skelton
			 National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2011
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Ike Skelton National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2011/s:2815

quote.#tail: and dated April 20, 2012, which was prepared in accordance with
quote.#text:
Study Relating to the Presence of Unexploded Ordnance in a Portion of the Former Naval Bombardment
			 Area of Culebra Island, Commonwealth of Puerto Rico

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new sentence:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 204(c) of the Military Construction Authorization Act, 1974

header.#text: Modification of restriction on Federal decontamination authority

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4705 IH: To amend the Military Construction Authorization Act, 1974 to authorize the Secretary of Defense to decontaminate certain portions of the former bombardment area on the island of Culebra, Puerto Rico.
